meanings.sent1: The rabbits decided to boink in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: Cats and dogs do not boink like humans do.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirped happily as they watched the rabbits boink.
meanings.sent4: The thunder and lightning seemed to boink together in the stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The romantic movie ended with the main characters about to boink.

meanings.sent1: The boink of the rubber ball echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent2: The clown's nose made a funny boink when squeezed.
meanings.sent3: The boink of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The boink of the door closing signaled the start of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The boink of the spring bouncing back and forth was soothing.

meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp blow or jolt.
meanings.sent1: The boink on the head left a small bump.
meanings.sent2: The boink of the hammer hitting the nail was loud.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected boink on the shoulder made him jump.
meanings.sent4: The car hitting the pothole caused a loud boink.
meanings.sent5: The boink of the basketball hitting the backboard echoed in the gym.
